I’ve been overwhelmingly happy with Octopress since the switch. There’s just one gap: image resizing and uploading. I didn’t realise how much I took this for granted with WordPress and Tumblr.

To fill the gap I’ve written a script which takes a local image path, resizes a small and large version to your specification, uploads it to a server and returns a block of HTML of the small image linking to the larger one. I used it for this post and it saved a lot of time. I also like that it decouples my image locations from my blog engine if ever I want to move again.

It’s not pretty code and it’s been made specifically to cater for my requirements but I hope someone else can find it useful either as it is or as a base for something better.
